title: The Bachelor's Abbie Chatfield confirms her romance with Todd King
text:
She was blindsided when Matt Agnew dumped her during The Bachelor finale.

But in a surprise twist, Abbie Chatfield has found happiness with another jilted reality star: The Bachelorette runner-up Todd King.

The pair, who have been the subject of dating rumours for weeks, recently confirmed their romance with a very public beach date.

It's official! Abbie Chatfield (pictured) has confirmed her romance with The Bachelorette's Todd King, after being dumped by Matt Agnew in The Bachelor finale

In photos published by New Idea magazine, the couple can be seen frolicking on the beach together in Noosa, Queensland.

Abbie and Todd first sparked romance rumours last month when they exchanged flirty comments on Instagram.

After Todd defended Abbie against sexist trolls, she replied with: 'Send me a date card already, you feminist icon.'

It's on! Abbie and Todd (pictured on The Bachelorette) were pictured canoodling at the beach in Noosa, Queensland recently

'Send me a date card already, you feminist icon': Abbie and Todd first sparked romance rumours last month when they exchanged flirty comments on Instagram (pictured)

According to New Idea, the 24-year-old property analyst has been telling friends about her relationship but wants to keep it low key.

'I am dating someone, but I can't say who it is,' she apparently told a pal.

Meanwhile, another source told Daily Mail Australia that Abbie and Todd attended a documentary screening at the XCargo bar in Brisbane last week.

Sshh! According to New Idea, Abbie has been telling friends about her relationship but wants to keep it low key

'They were definitely together,' said the insider. 'They were following each other around all night and he couldn't keep his hands off her.'

Abbie made it to the finale of The Bachelor, but was left heartbroken when Matt Agnew chose Chelsie McLeod as his winner instead.

Todd had faced a similar disappointment last year, when Bachelorette Ali Oetjen dumped him for bank manager Taite Radley.
